Title: Death Has a Shadow
Description: After drinking too much at a stag party and falling asleep at work, Peter loses his job, signs up for welfare, and gets more money than expected.

Title: I Never Met the Dead Man
Description: Peter goes into shock after he disables the entire Quahog cable system while giving Meg driving lessons; Stewie plots to rid the world of broccoli.

Title: Chitty Chitty Death Bang
Description: Peter tries to make the best of a bad situation after he ruins Lois's plans for Stewie's birthday party; Meg's new friend tries to recruit her into a cult.

Title: Mind Over Murder
Description: Under house arrest, Peter transforms the basement into a bar, where Lois' singing becomes the main attraction.

Title: A Hero Sits Next Door
Description: Peter becomes very jealous, when his handi-capable new neighbor turns out to be the new star player on the toy company's softball team.

Title: The Son Also Draws
Description: A chance encounter with a prune smoothie puts in motion a series of events that ultimately allows Peter to accept Chris' artistic side.

Title: Brian: Portrait of a Dog
Description: Brian's life is on the line after he refuses to be treated like a dog.

Title: Peter, Peter, Caviar Eater
Description: Peter changes for the worse after he and Lois inherit a mansion in Newport.

Title: Holy Crap
Description: Peter seeks divine inspiration when his retired father comes to visit and makes life troublesome; Chris suffers a gastrointestinal impasse.

Title: Da Boom
Description: Peter's paranoia about the end of the world makes the family cancel their New Year's Eve '99 plans, but for once, Peter is actually somewhat right.

Title: Brian in Love
Description: Brian turns to a therapist after his unrequited love for Lois causes him to lose control of his bladder.

Title: Love Thy Trophy
Description: Everyone on Spooner Street becomes enemies when a trophy they all won mysteriously goes missing; Meg makes extra tips as a waitress by telling everyone she's Stewie's teenage mother.

Title: Death Is a Bitch
Description: Death pays a visit to the Griffins after Peter fakes his death on an insurance form to avoid paying a hefty hospital bill.

Title: The King Is Dead
Description: Lois becomes the director of the Quahog Player's Theatre, until Peter becomes producer and changes everything.

Title: I Am Peter, Hear Me Roar
Description: Peter receives feminine training at a woman's retreat after his joke about women offends a female co-worker.

Title: If I'm Dyin' I'm Lyin'
Description: Peter pretends Chris is dying so that Make-A-Dream-Come-True foundation can save a cancelled TV Show.

Title: Running Mates
Description: Peter resorts to mudslinging, when he and Lois run as opponents in an election for the school board; Chris has a sexual awakening.

Title: A Picture Is Worth 1,000 Bucks
Description: Chris becomes the toast of the New York art scene, after Peter uses one his painting as the car's window.

Title: Fifteen Minutes of Shame
Description: A vivacious actress will replace Meg, when a reality show based on the Griffins' home life becomes a ratings sensation in the MTV network.

Title: Road to Rhode Island
Description: Brian and Stewie embark on a cross-country journey home; Peter becomes addicted to marriage counselling videos hosted by an adult film star.

Title: Let's Go to the Hop
Description: Peter infiltrates the high school after it's gripped by a toad-licking craze.

Title: Dammit Janet
Description: Stevie falls madly in love with another toddler at his new daycare; Peter takes advantage of Lois' new career as a stewardess.

Title: There's Something About Paulie
Description: The mob puts a hit out on Lois, after her meddling puts an end to Peter's unwanted friendship with a crime lord's obnoxious nephew.

Title: He's Too Sexy for His Fat
Description: Peter's drastic plastic surgery and liposuction procedures will transform him from a fatherly slob into a beautiful snob, and the family is not sure what to do.

Title: E. Peterbus Unum
Description: A zoning malfunction committed by the city planners gives Peter the opportunity to convert the Griffin household in the sovereign nation of Petirua.

Title: The Story on Page One
Description: Peter substitutes Meg's dreary newspaper article on Mayor Adam West with a steamy exposé that tries to out Hollywood actor Luke Perry.

Title: Wasted Talent
Description: Lois learns that Peter is a drunken savant when it comes to playing the piano, after he goes on a drinking binge to win one of Pawtucket Pat's silver scrolls.

Title: Fore, Father
Description: Peter tries to teach Chris a lesson in responsibility by getting him a job at the local golf course; Brian convinces Stewie he was poisoned by a booster shot.

Title: The Thin White Line
Description: Brian becomes a drug-sniffing dog for police to get out of a rut after taking the advice of his therapist, but the cocaine may be more than he can handle.

Title: Brian Does Hollywood
Description: When Brian leaves the family for Hollywood with dreams of becoming a screenwriter and director, he winds up directing a porn video.

Title: Mr. Griffin Goes to Washington
Description: After the toy company is taken over by a tobacco company, Peter is set up as the president and is sent to Washington to lobby against a bill.

Title: One If by Clam, Two If by Sea
Description: When a hurricane destroys The Drunken Clam, it is bought by a British man who turns it into an English pub to the dismay of Peter and the gang.

Title: And the Wiener Is...
Description: Peter becomes jealous of Chris' very large endowment.

Title: Death Lives
Description: Peter dies again, and Death shows him the errors of his ways.

Title: Lethal Weapons
Description: Lois takes Tae-Jitsu, quickly becomes a black-belt and scares away all of the frustrating New Yorkers that had come to Quahog to view the leaves.

Title: The Kiss Seen Round the World
Description: Meg takes an internship to work for Tom with Neil as her partner and kisses him during a life-threading situation that is caught on tape.

Title: Mr. Saturday Knight
Description: Losing his job at the toy factory is he least of his concerns, when Peter is caught monkeying around with a renaissance fair wench.

Title: A Fish Out of Water
Description: Peter tries to pay of the debts he accrued while pursuing his dream of owning a commercial fishing boat by catching an infamous, man-eating fish.

Title: Emission Impossible
Description: After Peter helps deliver Lois's sister's baby, he and Lois decide to try to have another kid, but Stewie will attempt to foil their new plan.

Title: To Love and Die in Dixie
Description: After Chris witnesses a convenience store robbery, the Griffins are put in the witness protection program and relocated to the Deep South.

Title: Screwed the Pooch
Description: Brian confesses to Peter and Lois that he has had sexual yearnings lately, so Lois suggests that Brian join them for a change of scenery.

Title: Peter Griffin: Husband, Father... Brother?
Description: While learning about his family history, Chris discovers that one of Peter's ancestors was a black slave once owned by the Pewterschmidts.

Title: Ready, Willing and Disabled
Description: Joe becomes a media darling after Peter spikes his sports drink with steroids during a track and field event for the disabled; the kids bicker over $26 they found.

Title: A Very Special Family Guy Freakin' Christmas
Description: Holiday mishaps include Lois going ballistic after losing her Christmas cheer and Peter not being able to watch the KISS Christmas special.

Title: Brian Wallows and Peter's Swallows
Description: Brian is sentenced to community service following a drunk driving episode; Peter cares for three endangered nestlings living in his freshly-grown beard.

Title: From Method to Madness
Description: When Brian shows interest in theatre, Lois convinces him to try out for School of Performing Arts, but during the audition, Brian is dismissed by the judges.

Title: Stuck Together, Torn Apart
Description: Peter's jealously reaches its peak when going with Lois to the gynecologist, who prepares to examine Lois, but Peter refuses to let him near her.

Title: Road to Europe
Description: Stewie and Brian go on a Pan-European journey back home after becoming stranded in Saudi Arabia; Peter is aghast to learn Lois is not really a fan of KISS.

Title: Family Guy Viewer Mail #1
Description: Peter gets three wishes by a genie; The Griffins get superpowers; Quahog turns into the Little Rascals.

Title: When You Wish Upon a Weinstein
Description: Driven by his tilted views on Judaism, Peter goes from finding a Jewish accountant to throwing Chris a Bar Mitzvah to make him smart. Meanwhile, a group of angry Catholics are trying to hunt down Peter.

Title: North by North Quahog
Description: Peter and Lois try for a second honeymoon, but things go awry when he poses as Mel Gibson.

Title: Fast Times at Buddy Cianci Jr. High
Description: Chris gets seduced by his new homicidal English teacher; Brian becomes a substitute teacher to a class of thugs.

Title: Blind Ambition
Description: Peter's desire to become famous for something causes him to go blind.

Title: Don't Make Me Over
Description: After a makeover, Meg becomes an insufferable starlet.

Title: The Cleveland-Loretta Quagmire
Description: Cleveland's wife Loretta has an affair with Quagmire.

Title: Petarded
Description: After winning at the children's edition of trivial pursuit, Peter thinks he's a genius until testing proves that he's actually intellectually disabled.

Title: Brian the Bachelor
Description: Brian takes part in "The Bachelorette"; Chris takes advice from his talking pimple.

Title: 8 Simple Rules for Buying My Teenage Daughter
Description: Peter resorts to selling Meg to Mort Goldman to pay off his pharmacy tab; Stewie falls in love with his babysitter.

Title: Breaking Out Is Hard to Do
Description: Lois goes to jail after a shoplifting crime spree, but when the family breaks her out, they're forced to live in Asiantown.

Title: Model Misbehavior
Description: Lois becomes a model, but goes overboard with the glamour life.

Title: Peter's Got Woods
Description: Brian tries to rename James Woods High School, but Peter pulls out a surprise weapon.

Title: The Perfect Castaway
Description: Peter and the guys get stranded on an island, and after being rescued months later, Peter realizes things aren't what they used to be.

Title: Jungle Love
Description: To avoid Freshman hazing, Chris runs away to South America, when the family get him, Peter learns that he's the richest man in the tribe.

Title: PTV
Description: After an incident at the Emmys, the FCC overreacts, so Peter decides to start his own cable network, until the FCC shut him down and start censoring his life.

Title: Brian Goes Back to College
Description: Brian re-enrolls at Brown while Peter and the guys become the new A-Team.

Title: The Courtship of Stewie's Father
Description: Peter tries to bond with Stewie in a number of different ways.

Title: Fat Guy Strangler
Description: Lois discovers a long-lost brother, but her new relative has a deadly secret.

Title: The Father, the Son and the Holy Fonz
Description: Peter's father Francis visits and learns Stewie has not been baptized. He and Peter take Stewie without Lois' permission and have him baptized. Learning this, Lois impresses upon Peter that Stewie should have a choice so he starts one.

Title: Brian Sings and Swings
Description: Brian and Stewie go on tour singing classic tunes with Frank Sinatra, Jr.

Title: Patriot Games
Description: After quarterback Tom Brady witnesses Peter pummeling several people in order to get to the bathroom, he recruits him to play for the New England Patriots.

Title: I Take Thee, Quagmire
Description: Quagmire falls in love with and marries the maid that Peter won on a game show only to find out that she's a psycho and must figure out a way to get out of it.

Title: Sibling Rivalry
Description: Peter reluctantly agrees to get a vasectomy, and refuses to have sex, causing Lois to gain weight; Stewie's half-brother Bertram declare an all-out war for control over the playground.

Title: Deep Throats
Description: While Meg interns for Mayor West, Brian uncovers a scandal; Peter and Lois decide to reunite their old groovy band

Title: Peterotica
Description: Peter writes an erotic novel, but a lawsuit leaves his investor, Carter, broke, forcing him to move in with the Griffins; Stewie trains for the Olympics.

Title: You May Now Kiss the... Uh... Guy Who Receives
Description: Brian's gay cousin Jasper comes to town to marry his fiancé, until Mayor West bans gay marriage to distract everyone from a financial scandal.

Title: Petergeist
Description: Peter's attempt to open build a movie theater on the Indian burial ground in his backyard releases a poltergeist that sucks Stewie into the television set.

Title: Untitled Griffin Family History
Description: When burglars break into the house, the Griffins take cover in the attic, where Peter tells them about their family history.

Title: Stewie B. Goode
Description: A near-death experience inspires Stewie to change his life.

Title: Bango Was His Name Oh!
Description: Stewie searches for a man he saw on TV who he believes is his real father.

Title: Stu & Stewie's Excellent Adventure
Description: Stewie meets his future self, who lives a pathetic life.

Title: Stewie Loves Lois
Description: After she saves Rupert, Stewie smothers Lois with affection; After his first prostate exam, Peter sues Dr. Hartman for sexual harassment.

Title: Mother Tucker
Description: Peter's mom starts dating Tom Tucker; Brian and Stewie host their own raunchy radio program.

Title: Hell Comes to Quahog
Description: Meg takes a job at a new superstore, which causes Peter to lose his job and the town's electricity.

Title: Saving Private Brian
Description: Stewie and Brian join the army and are sent to Iraq; Chris becomes the lead singer of a rock band.

Title: Whistle While Your Wife Works
Description: Lois does Peter's work while he recovers from losing his fingers in an accident; Brian begins dating an unintelligent woman, much to Stewie's delight.

Title: Prick Up Your Ears
Description: Lois becomes the school's sex ed teacher, but is fired for having "radical" views; Stewie attempts to kill the Tooth Fairy.

Title: Chick Cancer
Description: Stewie tries to win over retired child actress Olivia; Peter makes his own chick flick.

Title: Barely Legal
Description: After taking her to the prom, Meg becomes obsessed with Brian; The guys join the police force to help Joe.

Title: Road to Rupert
Description: After Brian accidentally sells Rupert at a yard sale, he and Stewie travel to Aspen to get him back; Meg is forced to be Peter's driver after he loses his license.

Title: Peter's Two Dads
Description: After Francis dies, Peter learns his real father lives in Ireland, so he and Brian set out to find him.

Title: The Tan Aquatic with Steve Zissou
Description: Peter becomes the neighborhood bully; Stewie has a cancer scare after staying in a tanning bed too long.

Title: Airport '07
Description: Peter becomes a redneck and gets Quagmire fired. So the gang sets out to get Quagmire his job back.

Title: Bill & Peter's Bogus Journey
Description: Peter's attempts to become physically fit lead to a friendship with Bill Clinton, which inadvertently nearly destroys Peter & Lois' marriage.

Title: No Meals on Wheels
Description: After Peter finds a valuable coin and sells it for $50, 000, he opens his own restaurant, but things don't end well when he bans Joe and all of his handicapped friends.

Title: Boys Do Cry
Description: When Stewie gets sick from communion, the town is convinced he's possessed by the devil, forcing the family to go on the run, and end up in Texas.

Title: No Chris Left Behind
Description: After being expelled for having the lowest average standardized test score, Chris is accepted into a snobby private school, forcing the family to struggle to pay the tuition.

Title: It Takes a Village Idiot, and I Married One
Description: Lois becomes the new Mayor of Quahog, but soon becomes corrupt with power.

Title: Meet the Quagmires
Description: Death grants Peter's wish to go back in time to 1984 to be 18 again, but when he bails on Lois, he soon learns he's alters the present, where Lois is married to Quagmire.

Title: Blue Harvest
Description: With the Griffins stuck at home during a blackout, Peter tells the story of Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope.

Title: Movin' Out (Brian's Song)
Description: Brian moves in with Jillian, but Stewie moves in to to help pay the rent. Meg and Chris both get jobs at the local convenience store.

Title: Believe It or Not, Joe's Walking on Air
Description: Joe gets a leg transplant to allow him to walk again, only for his new legs to make him abandon Bonnie and the guys.

Title: Stewie Kills Lois
Description: Stewie kills Lois, and one year after her disappearance, Peter is charged with her death.

Title: Lois Kills Stewie
Description: With Lois back in Quahog, Stewie escapes with Brian to Washington, D.C. and sets out to initiate his latest plan for world domination.

Title: Padre de Familia
Description: Peter discovers that he is an illegal Mexican immigrant, so he is forced to take a job as a day laborer for Lois's father.

Title: Peter's Daughter
Description: When Meg awakens from a coma, Peter vows to treat her better than before, but doesn't approve of her dating an attractive doctor.

Title: McStroke
Description: Peter sues a fast food chain after he suffers a stroke from eating over 30 hamburgers in one sitting.

Title: Back to the Woods
Description: James Woods gets his revenge on Peter by stealing his identity and moving in with his family.

Title: Play It Again, Brian
Description: Brian decides to declare his love for Lois as she and Peter accompany him to a writers' convention, and the Griffin kids are babysat by Herbert.

Title: The Former Life of Brian
Description: When Brian decides to look up an old flame on a whim, he discovers, to his horror, that he is the father of her teenage son.

Title: Long John Peter
Description: Peter begins to act like a pirate when he gets a parrot, creating havoc in Quahog; Chris falls for vet intern Anna.

Title: Love Blactually
Description: Stewie convinces Brian to take it slow with his new girlfriend, but she becomes impatient and hooks up with Cleveland. Brian then tries to get Cleveland back together with his ex-wife Loretta to get him out of the picture.

Title: I Dream of Jesus
Description: Peter rediscovers his favorite song, "Surfin' Bird" by the Trashmen, and discovers that Jesus Christ is working at a used record store in Quahog, and sets out to let everyone know that he has come back.

Title: Road to Germany
Description: Stewie and Brian use a time machine to go back to Nazi-era Poland and rescue Mort.

Title: Baby Not on Board
Description: The Griffins decide to take a vacation to the Grand Canyon, only to leave Stewie behind.

Title: The Man with Two Brians
Description: Peter gets the Griffins a new, younger dog to eventually replace an aging Brian.

Title: Tales of a Third Grade Nothing
Description: Peter must pass the third grade in order to get a promotion at the brewery; Stewie turns Brian and Frank Sinatra Jr.'s nightclub into a trendy hotspot.

Title: Ocean's Three and a Half
Description: The guys try to help Joe and Bonnie get money for their hospital bill after their baby is born, a baby who Stewie develops a crush on.

Title: Family Gay
Description: Peter becomes temporarily gay after participating in a medical study.

Title: The Juice Is Loose!
Description: Everyone is up in arms after Peter becomes friends with O.J. Simpson.

Title: FOX-y Lady
Description: Lois becomes a Fox News anchor; Peter and Chris try to sell a cartoon pilot to the Fox network.

Title: Not All Dogs Go to Heaven
Description: Meg becomes religious and tries to convert Brian from Atheism; Stewie teleports the cast of Star Trek: The Next Generation to Quahog.
Brian becomes the leading proponent for legalization of marijuana in Quahog.

Title: Stew-Roids
Description: Stewie begins taking steroids after being beat up by Susie; Chris starts dating popular girl Connie.

Title: We Love You Conrad
Description: Brian dates "Hills" star Lauren Conrad while trying to hide the fact that he is in love with someone else.

Title: Three Kings
Description: A series of parodies based on the Stephen King movies "Stand by Me," "Misery," and "The Shawshank Redemption."

Title: Peter's Progress
Description: The story of Griffin Peterson and the founding of Quahog.

Title: Road to the Multiverse
Description: Brian and Stewie explore a series of alternate universes.

Title: Family Goy
Description: When Lois finds out her mother was a Holocaust survivor, Peter decides to adopt the Jewish faith.

Title: Spies Reminiscent of Us
Description: With the help of Chevy Chase and Dan Aykroyd, Stewie and Brian discover that Mayor West is a Cold War sleeper agent; Peter and the guys start an improv group.

Title: Brian's Got a Brand New Bag
Description: Brian becomes the laughing stock of the family when he begins dating an older woman, but things get worse when she breaks her hip and he has to be her errand-boy.

Title: Hannah Banana
Description: Brian helps Stewie meet Miley Cyrus, only to discover a secret about her identity; The family discovers that the evil monkey in Chris's closet isn't actually evil.

Title: Quagmire's Baby
Description: Quagmire is forced to take care of a baby he fathered when she is left on his doorstep, while Stewie creates clones of himself and Brian.

Title: Jerome Is the New Black
Description: The guys find a new black friend to join their group, until Peter finds out that he slept with Lois. Meanwhile, Brian tries to find out why Quagmire hates him and tries to make amends.

Title: Dog Gone
Description: After accidentally killing another dog and surprised that no one cares, Brian tries to convince everyone that dogs should have the same value as humans.

Title: Business Guy
Description: Peter takes over Pewterschmidt Industries when Carter has a heart attack and goes into a coma.

Title: Big Man on Hippocampus
Description: When Peter develops amnesia after hitting his head, he forgets everything and everyone, forcing the family to help regain his memory.

Title: Dial Meg for Murder
Description: Meg goes to prison after her boyfriend escapes from jail, and returns as a frightening, hardened sociopath.

Title: Extra Large Medium
Description: Peter pretends to be a psychic after Lois sees one after Chris and Stewie get lost in the woods; Chris asks a girl with Down Syndrome out on a date.

Title: Go, Stewie, Go!
Description: Stewie poses as a girl so that he can appear on Jolly Farm, and falls for a female co-star; Peter makes Lois feel bad about her age.

Title: Peter-assment
Description: Peter is sexually harassed by Angela, but will he follow through with her advances and keep his job?

Title: Brian Griffin's House of Payne
Description: CBS turns Brian's pilot for a heartwarming drama into a sitcom starring James Woods; Meg and Chris try to hide Stewie's accidental head injury.

Title: April in Quahog
Description: Peter makes an embarrassing confession about his kids as everyone thinks the world is about to come to an end.

Title: Brian & Stewie
Description: Brian and Stewie get locked in a bank vault where they are forced to deal with each other on a whole new level.

Title: Quagmire's Dad
Description: Quagmire's dad undergoes a sex change, and Brian, who was out of town for a seminar, ends up sleeping with him after the sex change.

Title: The Splendid Source
Description: With Cleveland's help, Peter, Joe, and Quagmire blow off a couples' getaway to Maine to search for the origin of the world's funniest dirty joke.

Title: Something, Something, Something, Dark Side
Description: Peter makes good on another power outage at home by retelling Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back.

Title: Partial Terms of Endearment
Description: Lois agrees to be a surrogate mother for her friend, but when she unexpectedly dies, Lois and Peter argue over whether to continue with the pregnancy.

Title: And Then There Were Fewer
Description: The residents of Quahog are invited to James Woods' house, where a murder mystery takes place.

Title: Excellence in Broadcasting
Description: Brian does a 180 on Rush Limbaugh and befriends him after he reads one of his books.

Title: Welcome Back Carter
Description: After Peter catches Carter having an affair, he is strong-armed into keeping a secret, until he accidentally spills the beans.

Title: Halloween on Spooner Street
Description: Peter and Joe team up to execute Halloween pranks on Quagmire; Brian shows Stewie the ropes of trick-or-treating; Meg sets out to attend her first high school Halloween party.

Title: Baby, You Knock Me Out
Description: Lois becomes a champion foxy boxer, and Peter acts as her manager.

Title: Brian Writes a Bestseller
Description: Brian's self-help book becomes a best-seller after Stewie becomes his manager; Lois decides that she and Peter need separate beds, leaving him to look for a new cuddle buddy.

Title: Road to the North Pole
Description: Disappointed with the Mall Santa, Stewie and Brian decide to go up to the North Pole to teach Santa a lesson, only to face a shocking revelation.

Title: New Kidney in Town
Description: Peter needs a new kidney after he destroys his making his own Red Bull; Chris gets to introduce President Obama after plagiarizing Meg's poem.

Title: And I'm Joyce Kinney
Description: Lois becomes friends with the new news anchor, only to have her reveal Lois's most embarrassing secret on air.

Title: Friends of Peter G.
Description: After a public disturbance, Peter and Brian are forced to attend a 12-step meeting to help kick their drinking problems. Unable to recognize his issue, Peter gets a visit from Death, who gives him a glimpse of what life would be like with and without "Mr. Booze" in his bloodstream.

Title: German Guy
Description: A jealous Mr. Herbert tries to tell Chris that the elderly German puppeteer that he is hanging out with is actually a notorious Nazi war criminal.

Title: The Hand That Rocks the Wheelchair
Description: While taking care of Joe, Meg develops a crush on him; Stewie creates an evil clone who escapes the house.

Title: Trading Places
Description: Chris and Meg think their parents have it easy, and Peter and Lois beg to differ, so in order to teach them a lesson, they all trade places.

Title: Tiegs for Two
Description: Brian enlists Quagmire's help to score a date with a new friend, but things get nasty when they start to compete for the affections of each other's old flames, Cheryl Tiegs and Jillian.

Title: Brothers & Sisters
Description: After yet another failed marriage, Lois' sister, Carol, comes to stay, and quickly falls in love with Mayor West.

Title: The Big Bang Theory
Description: Stewie and Brian go back in time to stop Bertram from killing Leonardo da Vinci.

Title: Foreign Affairs
Description: Lois goes on a vacation with Bonnie to Paris, unaware of her intentions; Peter homeschools Chris and Meg.

Title: It's a Trap!
Description: The Griffins reprise their intergalactic roles in an outrageous retelling of Return of the Jedi.

Title: Lottery Fever
Description: When the Griffins win millions in the lottery, they can't handle the good fortune and struggle to stay grounded.

Title: Seahorse Seashell Party
Description: As a hurricane hits Quahog, Brian gets high on mushrooms; Meg finally summons up the courage to confront the family.

Title: Screams of Silence: The Story of Brenda Q
Description: Quagmire and the guys try to save his sister Brenda from her abusive boyfriend.

Title: Stewie Goes for a Drive
Description: Stewie runs away after crashing Brian's car; Peter befriends Ryan Reynolds.

Title: Back to the Pilot
Description: Brian and Stewie travel back in time to January 31, 1999 to change history, only to alter the past with dire consequences.

Title: Thanksgiving
Description: Joe's son, who was reported missing in Iraq, suddenly and unexpectedly appears during Thanksgiving dinner, but the story of his disappearance doesn't add up.

Title: Amish Guy
Description: The Griffins stay in an Amish village after their car breaks down, but problems arise when Meg falls for a boy in the village.

Title: Cool Hand Peter
Description: Peter and the guys take a stand against their wives and flee to the Deep South on a road trip, only to earn a one-way ticket to jail.

Title: Grumpy Old Man
Description: Lois's dad retires to a senior community in Florida, but has trouble getting used to it.

Title: Meg and Quagmire
Description: When Meg turns 18, Quagmire tries to make his move on her, but Peter tries to stop him.

Title: The Blind Side
Description: Brian dates a blind woman who hates dogs; Peter can't stop falling down the new stairs.

Title: Livin' on a Prayer
Description: Lois takes matters into her own hands when Stewie's sick friend is denied medical treatment by his Christian Scientists parents.

Title: Tom Tucker: The Man and His Dream
Description: Peter helps Tom Tucker revive his acting career; Chris starts dating a girl who looks exactly like Lois.

Title: Be Careful What You Fish For
Description: Peter befriends a dolphin who moves in, and soon becomes annoying; Stewie asks for Brian's help in busting a negligent day care worker.

Title: Burning Down the Bayit
Description: Mort, Peter and Quagmire burn down Goldman's pharmacy to collect the insurance money, but things go awry when Joe starts to look into the case.

Title: Killer Queen
Description: Peter and Chris are sent to fat camp, where a serial killer targets overweight kids; Stewie is traumatized by the frightening Queen album cover.

Title: Forget-Me-Not
Description: After a car accident, Peter, Brian, Joe, and Quagmire wake up in a hospital with no memory and discover that they're the last people left on Earth.

Title: You Can't Do That on Television, Peter
Description: Peter creates his own children's TV show, portraying Lois as an annoying nag; Meg shadows Dr. Hartman.

Title: Mr. & Mrs. Stewie
Description: Stewie falls for a girl who's just as wicked as him; Peter and Quagmire take their friendship to the next level.

Title: Leggo My Meg-O
Description: When Meg and her friend are kidnapped in Paris, Stewie and Brian fly to Paris to rescue her.

Title: Tea Peter
Description: Peter joins the Tea Party, only to discover that Carter Pewterschmidt is using the party to get rid of the government for his own selfish motives.

Title: Family Guy Viewer Mail #2
Description: A British version of Family Guy; Everybody Peter touches turns into Robin Williams; A day through Stewie's point of view.

Title: Internal Affairs
Description: Peter talks Joe into having an affair with his new attractive partner, until Bonnie finds out.

Title: Into Fat Air
Description: The Griffins try to beat Lois's obnoxious ex-boyfriend's family to the top of Mount Everest.

Title: Ratings Guy
Description: After the Griffins become a Nielsen Family, everyone gets mad at Peter for convincing the networks to make ridiculous changes to popular shows.

Title: The Old Man and the Big 'C'
Description: Brian and Stewie learn that Carter Pewterschmidt's company has developed a cure for cancer, but is keeping it from the public.

Title: Yug Ylimaf
Description: Brian causes time to move backwards when he tampers with Stewie's time machine, which may result in Stewie being unborn.

Title: Joe's Revenge
Description: Joe, with the help of Peter and Quagmire, looks to track down the person responsible for his injuries.

Title: Lois Comes Out of Her Shell
Description: Lois goes through a mid-life crisis; Stewie discovers that his new pet turtle is evil.

Title: Friends Without Benefits
Description: Meg finds out that her crush is actually gay and is interested in Chris.

Title: Jesus, Mary and Joseph!
Description: The Griffins decorate their tree while Peter tells the story of Christmas.

Title: Space Cadet
Description: The Griffins wind up stuck in orbit on a space shuttle after Peter and Lois send Chris to Florida for space camp.

Title: Brian's Play
Description: Brian receives widespread acclaim for his new play, until Stewie writes one overnight that puts his to shame.

Title: The Giggity Wife
Description: After a drunken night out at Harvard with the guys, Quagmire discovers that he married a decrepit old prostitute.

Title: Valentine's Day in Quahog
Description: Shows how the individual characters spend their Valentine's Day.

Title: Chris Cross
Description: Chris is fed up with Meg blackmailing him, so he moves in with Mr. Herbert; Stewie and Brian become huge fans of Anne Murray.

Title: Call Girl
Description: Lois works for a phone sex line and Peter falls in love with her, not knowing that he is actually speaking to his wife.

Title: Turban Cowboy
Description: Peter becomes a Muslim but later discovers that he is also part of a terrorist plot to blow up a bridge in Quahog.

Title: 12 and a Half Angry Men
Description: Mayor West is on trial for murder, and Brian is the only one on the jury who thinks he is not guilty.

Title: Bigfat
Description: Peter reverts back to a feral state after being lost in the Canadian wilderness for two months after a plane crash.

Title: Total Recall
Description: Stewie tries to rescue Rupert after he is recalled; Lois hangs out with Joe and Quagmire while Peter is sick.

Title: Save the Clam
Description: The guys fight to save The Drunken Clam from closing after Horace dies; Meg gets a job at a funeral home.

Title: Farmer Guy
Description: Due to the high crime rate in Quaghog, the family move to a farm, where they discover a meth lab in the basement.

Title: Roads to Vegas
Description: Stewie's teleportation device malfunctions when he and Brian use it to travel to Las Vegas.

Title: No Country Club for Old Men
Description: The Griffins are introduced to the Country Club lifestyle when Chris begins dating the owner's daughter, much to the chagrin of Carter.

Title: Finders Keepers
Description: Peter goes on a real-life treasure hunt based on a treasure map from a child's meal menu.

Title: Vestigial Peter
Description: Peter has a vestigial twin growing of his neck, and he has surgery to remove it and have it become a separate entity.

Title: Quagmire's Quagmire
Description: Quagmire begins dating a sexually insatiable woman; Stewie finds himself torn between Rupert and his old teddy bear Oscar.

Title: A Fistful of Meg
Description: Meg turns to Quagmire for help taking on a school bully; Brian looks for a way to get back at Peter for forcing him to see him naked.

Title: Boopa-dee Bappa-dee
Description: The Griffins take a trip to Italy and are forced to deal with annoying immigration laws after Peter destroys the family's passports.

Title: Life of Brian
Description: Brian dies and Stewie cannot use his time machine to save him. Meanwhile, Peter replaces Brian with an Italian dog named Vinny.

Title: Into Harmony's Way
Description: Fame gets to Peter when he forms a song writing team with Quagmire.

Title: Christmas Guy
Description: Peter fills Carter with the spirit of Christmas. Meanwhile, Stewie goes back in time to save Brian.

Title: Peter Problems
Description: Lately Peter hasn't been able to perform very well in the bedroom. So he asks Quagmire and Joe to step in and help him get his mojo back.

Title: Grimm Job
Description: Peter tells Stewie the stories "Jack and the Beanstalk," "Little Red Riding Hood," and "Cinderella."

Title: Brian's a Bad Father
Description: Brian uses his son to get a writing job for a TV show, and Quagmire stops being friends with Peter after Peter shoots him.

Title: Mom's the Word
Description: Peter is seduced by his late mother's longtime friend, while Stewie is distraught over the realities of death.

Title: 3 Acts of God
Description: Peter and the guys set out to find God and ask him to stop interfering in the outcomes of football games.

Title: Fresh Heir
Description: When Carter makes Chris the sole future heir to his fortune after caring for him, Peter takes drastic measures to keep the wealth within his reach.

Title: Secondhand Spoke
Description: Peter is asked to be the face of an anti-smoking campaign after taking up smoking cigarettes, while Stewie helps Chris face school bullies.

Title: Herpe, the Love Sore
Description: Stewie gets herpes from Brian, while Peter and the guys discover that another group has taken their favorite booth at the Drunken Clam.

Title: The Most Interesting Man in the World
Description: Lois calls Peter an idiot for bringing home the wrong baby, so he goes to Chicago on a business trip and returns a smart, classy person.

Title: Baby Got Black
Description: Chris runs away with Jerome's daughter Pam, whom Jerome has forbidden Chris from dating, so Jerome must work with Peter to find their kids.

Title: Meg Stinks!
Description: Peter takes Meg to a college for an interview, but end up partying; Brian is forced to live outside after being sprayed by a skunk.

Title: He's Bla-ack!
Description: Cleveland returns to Quahog, but is forbidden from spending time with Peter when their wives get into an argument over parenting.

Title: Chap Stewie
Description: Stewie tries to erase himself from history when Peter and Chris constantly interrupt his TV time, only to end up as the baby of a British family.

Title: The Simpsons Guy
Description: After fleeing Quahog due to Peter's misogynistic comic strip, the Griffins get their car stolen and end up getting stuck in Springfield.

Title: The Book of Joe
Description: Peter is hired to read Joe's new children's book; Brian takes up running to impress a girl.

Title: Baking Bad
Description: Peter and Lois open a bakery, but things get out of hand when Peter comes up with a way to attract customers.

Title: Brian the Closer
Description: After getting a cosmetic surgery, Brian becomes a real estate agent, only to get in trouble with Quagmire.

Title: Turkey Guys
Description: On the night before Thanksgiving, Peter and Brian get drunk and eat the whole turkey, so they have to get a new one on Thanksgiving Day. With Peter gone, Stewie tries to help Chris take over as the man of the house.

Title: The 2,000-Year-Old Virgin
Description: Peter and the guys set out to throw Jesus the best birthday party in order to help him lose his virginity.

Title: Stewie, Chris & Brian's Excellent Adventure
Description: Stewie and Brian take Chris back through time to help him with history class, only to end up stuck in the past.

Title: Our Idiot Brian
Description: Brian begins to think he's not so smart when he takes the SAT'S for Meg and gets a low score, so Peter decides to show him the joys of being an idiot.

Title: This Little Piggy
Description: Meg becomes a foot-fetish model; Brian accompanies Stewie on an adventure outside of preschool.

Title: Quagmire's Mom
Description: Quagmire faces charges of statutory rape, and during his trial, his mom makes a surprise appearance to explain why he is the way that he is.

Title: Encyclopedia Griffin
Description: Peter and the guys start a detective agency and discover that Chris is a thief. In the meantime, Lois is worried about Chris when gets involved in a delusional relationship.

Title: Stewie Is Enceinte
Description: Stewie impregnates himself with Brian's DNA to save their friendship, while Peter and the guys try to make a viral video.

Title: Dr. C and the Women
Description: Cleveland becomes an unlicensed therapist and gives Lois marriage advice that Peter does not like, and Quagmire gets Meg a job working in airport security.

Title: #JOLO
Description: Joe decides to embrace life by taking the guys on a road trip to Niagra Falls, where he makes an unexpected decision.

Title: Once Bitten
Description: Brian becomes more submissive as a result of attending obedience school and Chris discovers his new friend is using him to get close to Meg.

Title: Roasted Guy
Description: When Peter's insulted by old friends at a roasting of him, he joins a group of mean girls.

Title: Fighting Irish
Description: Peter prepares for a fight with Liam Neeson, while Lois becomes a class mom and pays more attention to the other children over Stewie.

Title: Take My Wife
Description: Lois books a couple's vacation, but it turns out to be a marriage counseling program. Carter is frustrated because the kids are so into their electronics.

Title: Pilling Them Softly
Description: Stewie gets addicted to ADHD medication; Peter and Quagmire make their own cooking shows which rival each other.

Title: Papa Has a Rollin' Son
Description: When Joe learns his father hates handicapped people, Peter pretends to be Joe; Stewie becomes friends with Tom Cruise after learning he will grow up to be only 5'1.

Title: Guy, Robot
Description: Stewie builds a robot friend; Lois makes Peter buy a new mattress.

Title: Peternormal Activity
Description: Things go horribly wrong when the guys try to come up with a horror movie; Stewie becomes irritated by Brian's new glasses.

Title: Peter, Chris & Brian
Description: After watching a VHS tape of his younger self, Peter, with Brian's help, launch a plan to make sure Chris doesn't take the same path.

Title: Peter's Sister
Description: Peter's sister Karen comes over for Thanksgiving, while Stewie goes a little too far as he and Brian go on a cleanse to avoid overeating.

Title: Hot Pocket-Dial
Description: Quagmire finally confesses his love for Lois, but it happens while he accidentally pocket dials Peter, who is furious, so Brian tries to fix the situation.

Title: Brokeback Swanson
Description: Joe becomes a quadriplegic while Brian has an affair with a married woman.

Title: A Shot in the Dark
Description: While participating in a newly formed neighborhood watch group, Peter is arrested and charged with a hate crime.

Title: Candy, Quahog Marshmallow
Description: When the guys travel to Korea to retrieve the final episode of a soap opera Quagmire starred in, Quagmire is reunited with a former lover.

Title: The Peanut Butter Kid
Description: Stewie's new role brings Peter and Lois into show business.

Title: Scammed Yankees
Description: Peter and Carter go to Africa to return Carter's money he lost to a Nigerian scammer. Meanwhile, Brian tries to hook up with one of Meg's friends after he finds out that she has a surprisingly great body.

Title: An App a Day
Description: Peter learns about phone apps and overloads his phone with them. He buys a new phone with more memory and gives his old phone to Chris, which causes a series of horrible events. Meanwhile, Stewie joins a tennis club and invites Brian to be his tennis partner.

Title: Underage Peter
Description: Peter uses Brian as a way to get alcohol, after Mayor West bans alcohol from all people under 50.

Title: A Lot Going on Upstairs
Description: Stewie builds a device to enable Brian to help him conquer his terrifying nightmares; Peter turns the attic into a man cave.

Title: The Heartbreak Dog
Description: Brian and Bonnie run away together after declaring their love for each other; Meg and Chris team up to steal from the residents in a retirement home.

Title: Take a Letter
Description: An old flame returns to Peter's life after Lois finds a dead letter at the post office. Stewie goes to a new preschool and tries to fit in with a rich new friend.

Title: The New Adventures of Old Tom
Description: Peter helps Tom Tucker when he's replaced with a young reporter; Brian pretends to be rich to impress a woman.

Title: Run, Chris, Run
Description: Meg discovers the cool kids only elected Chris homecoming king just to prank him; Cleveland starts hanging out with Jerome instead of the guys.

Title: Road to India
Description: Brian falls in love with a tech support girl, so he and Stewie go to India to find her; Peter becomes the center of attention when he's invited to Joe's bingo night.

Title: The Boys in the Band
Description: Stewie and Brian form a children's band that threatens to fall apart when Olivia gets involved; Chris gets a job managing Quagmire's sex life.

Title: Bookie of the Year
Description: Peter starts betting on Chris when he becomes a pitcher; Brian and Stewie re-team with Frank Sinatra, Jr. to start an Italian restaurant.

Title: American Gigg-olo
Description: After the pilots go on strike, Quagmire becomes a gigolo. Meanwhile, Brian works at a hardware store for the health insurance.

Title: Inside Family Guy
Description: James Woods leads viewers behind the scenes of the studios of Family Guy.

Title: Chris Has Got a Date, Date, Date, Date, Date
Description: Taylor Swift agrees to be Chris' Homecoming date; Peter becomes an Uber driver.

Title: Hot Shots
Description: Lois decides not to vaccinate Stewie to "save" him from autism, causing Stewie to run away, and cause the town to have an outbreak.

Title: High School English
Description: The classic novels "The Great Gatsby", "The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn", and "Of Mice and Men" are re-enacted.

Title: Carter and Tricia
Description: Carter falls in love with Channel 5 News reporter, Tricia Takanawa; Stewie becomes Brian's driving instructor.

Title: How the Griffin Stole Christmas
Description: Peter fills in for the mall Santa and becomes drunk with power; Stewie and Brian crash holiday office parties for free food, drama, and women.

Title: Passenger Fatty-Seven
Description: Quagmire's piloting skills are questioned when he scores free tickets to a guys' trip to San Francisco, and the plane is hijacked on the flight home.

Title: Gronkowsbees
Description: Rob Gronkowski moves in behind the Griffins; Stewie begins beekeeping, and gives them steroids, which makes them aggressive.

Title: Peter's Def Jam
Description: When the guys start a podcast, Peter goes solo and becomes a DJ; Lois' allergy forces Brian to move into Stewie's room.

Title: The Finer Strings
Description: Peter fails to make the cut when the guys form a string quartet; Brian enjoys the life of luxury too much as Carter's seeing eye dog.

Title: The Dating Game
Description: Quagmire discovers Tinder, forcing the guys to intervene; Stewie learns the perks of scoliosis.

Title: Cop and a Half-Wit
Description: Peter helps Joe solve crime cases; Stewie joins a football team, and panics when he gets a concussion.

Title: Saturated Fat Guy
Description: When Lois forces him to eat healthy food, Peter opens up his own food truck with fattening foods; Meg joins a roller derby team.

Title: Peter's Lost Youth
Description: Peter gets jealous when Lois upstages him at a Red Sox Fantasy Baseball camp; Stewie runs away when Meg babysits him.

Title: The Peter Principal
Description: Meg takes advantage of Peter's temporary job as principal to get even with her bullies; Brian and Stewie open a B&B that quickly turns into a brothel.

Title: Dearly Deported
Description: Chris volunteers to take care of his Mexican girlfriend's twin babies, but after learning that she can't come back to the U.S, the Griffins go to Mexico.

Title: A House Full of Peters
Description: Peter's past participation as a sperm donor catches up to him when his children start showing up at his house.

Title: Emmy-Winning Episode
Description: Peter decides to make "Family Guy" more like Emmy-winning shows so it can finally win TV's highest award.

Title: Foxx in the Men House
Description: Peter dumps Quagmire, Joe, and Cleveland when he becomes friends with a cool paramedic.

Title: Nanny Goats
Description: The Griffins get a nanny for the kids, giving Peter and Lois the opportunity to reconnect.

Title: Follow the Money
Description: Chris receives a special one-dollar bill for his birthday that gets passed throughout Quahog.

Title: Three Directors
Description: The story of Peter's firing from the brewery, as told in the styles of Quentin Tarantino, Wes Anderson, and Michael Bay.

Title: The D in Apartment 23
Description: Brian gets kicked out of the house for posting an offensive tweet that goes viral.

Title: Petey IV
Description: Vladimir Putin comes to Quahog after Peter writes to him. Meanwhile, strapped-for-cash Brian gets a job at a suicide hotline and pursues a coworker.

Title: Crimes and Meg's Demeanor
Description: Meg's drinking both concerns and delights Peter; Brian suspects Principal Shepherd of a crime.

Title: Don't Be a Dickens at Christmas
Description: Peter is visited by the ghosts of Christmas past, present and future, who take him on a journey around Quahog.

Title: Boy (Dog) Meets Girl (Dog)
Description: Brian enters a dog show to breed with a female dog; Peter and Lois try to convince Chris that "Arthur Valentine" doesn't exist.

Title: Dog Bites Bear
Description: Stewie and Brian have a falling out; Peter refuses to wash his hand after meeting his favorite cereal mascot.

Title: Send in Stewie, Please
Description: Stewie reveals secrets about himself in a session with his school psychologist.

Title: V is for Mystery
Description: Stewie and Brian become detectives and embark on solving a string of murders set in Victorian era London.

Title: Veteran Guy
Description: Peter and the guys get caught pretending to be military veterans and are sentenced to join the Coast Guard.

Title: The Woof of Wall Street
Description: Brian convinces Stewie to teach him how to invest in the stock market; Peter and the guys look after the Drunken Clam while Jerome is away.

Title: 'Family Guy' Through the Years
Description: The show looks back at the cultural events and issues that were tackled in the '50s, '60s and '70s.

Title: Switch the Flip
Description: Chaos ensues in Quahog when Stewie's body-swapping machine malfunctions.

Title: HTTPete
Description: Peter adopts the millennial lifestyle, attracting the attention of a high-powered Silicon Valley executive.

Title: The Unkindest Cut
Description: Quagmire has a freak accident; Stewie and Brian search for Mort after learning there is a $10,000 reward for turning him into the police.

Title: Are You There God? It's Me, Peter
Description: After falling into a coma, Peter comes face-to-face with God, leading him to ask some of life's tough questions.

Title: Married with Cancer
Description: Brian quickly falls in love with a woman, and after receiving devastating news regarding her cancer diagnosis, he proposes marriage.

Title: Dead Dog Walking
Description: Brian's marriage to Jess doesn't go as planned, so at Peter's suggestion, he lets himself go, leading Jess to make a surprising decision.

Title: Pal Stewie
Description: Stewie befriends a boy his age; Peter and Lois attend a seminar on self-empowerment.

Title: Big Trouble in Little Quahog
Description: Stewie invents a shrinking machine that shrinks him and Brian down to microscopic size.

Title: Regarding Carter
Description: Carter gives Lois a surprising birthday present that leads to an unfortunate accident, leaving him dependent on the Griffins' care.

Title: Stand by Meg
Description: Stewie vows to make Meg's life better after she saves him from choking; Chris is sent to a vocational school.

Title: The Griffin Winter Games
Description: Meg takes the family by surprise when she makes the US Winter Olympics team.

Title: Con Heiress
Description: Stewie and Brian compete for the inheritance of a wealthy old heiress. Peter and Chris battle for Mr. Herbert's affection.

Title: Pawtucket Pete
Description: When the Pawtucket Brewery's new bosses want to change the company's mascot, Peter and Brian go head-to-head to become the new face.

Title: Hefty Shades of Gray
Description: Tom Tucker teaches Peter how to report fake news; Brian and Stewie help Chris improve his love life.

Title: Trump Guy
Description: The Griffins move to the White House where Peter is hired as the new Press Secretary.

Title: Bri, Robot
Description: Brian worries about his legacy, so Stewie makes him a robot duplicate as a living biography; Peter starts working at a massage parlor.

Title: Trans-Fat
Description: Peter learns an important lesson when he's mistakenly identified as transgender.

Title: Family Guy Lite
Description: Peter goes on a health kick; when Lois starts writing a romantic fantasy novel, Brian and Stewie investigate into her possible crush.

Title: No Giggity, No Doubt
Description: Quagmire discovers a long-lost daughter and makes a serious effort to embrace parenting.

Title: You Can't Handle the Booth
Description: The Griffins provide DVD commentary on a recent episode and reveal never-before-told drama between Peter and Lois.

Title: Island Adventure
Description: Stewie and Brian travel to Garbage Island to retrieve his tricycle after Peter throws it out; Lois tries to help Quagmire court a middle-aged woman.

Title: Throw It Away
Description: Lois challenges the other Griffins to throw out anything that no longer gives them joy, only to take the decluttering to a surprising extreme.

Title: Girl, Internetted
Description: Meg becomes famous on the internet for her unhealthy eating; Brian and Stewie enjoy a new ride while Brian's car gets fixed.

Title: Adam West High
Description: Brian runs for Mayor after successfully renaming James Woods High after the late Adam West, only for Quagmire to campaign against him.

Title: Yacht Rocky
Description: When the brewery announces it will be firing one employee, the family take Peter on a cruise to calm his nerves, but the trip doesn't go as planned.

Title: Bri-Da
Description: Peter and the guys use Joe's body cams to remember the million-dollar ideas they have while drinking; Quagmire must come to terms with an unexpected family development.

Title: Absolutely Babulous
Description: Stewie wins a participation award in his school's toddler games, leading him to question everything he's ever won; Peter causes a fight between Lois' parents and has to repair the damage.

Title: Disney's The Reboot
Description: The network decides to reboot FAMILY GUY and the feedback takes surprising turns when three versions are shown to a focus group.

Title: Cat Fight
Description: Brian tries to shut down Quagmire's cat café; Lois decides to send Meg and Chris to church camp when they get in trouble at school.

Title: Peter & Lois' Wedding
Description: When the Wi-Fi goes out, Peter and Lois tell the kids the story of how they met and fell in love in this spoof of the '90s sitcom Friends and everything else '90s.

Title: Heart Burn
Description: To celebrate Peter and Lois' wedding anniversary, the Griffins present their own versions of three well-known love stories.

Title: Shanksgiving
Description: Peter gets himself arrested to avoid Lois' special Thanksgiving dinner; A secret that Stewie's been keeping from everyone is revealed.

Title: Christmas Is Coming
Description: Meg gets a surprising response when she takes Stewie to meet Santa at the mall; Brian tries to help when the experience leaves Stewie scarred.

Title: Connie's Celica
Description: Lois becomes the target of Connie's antics when she gets a job as the high school's music teacher.

Title: Short Cuts
Description: When Brian accidentally becomes a local hero, an old street pal who is now a successful millionaire dog reaches out and tries to convince him to get neutered; Lois gets a pixie cut against Peter's wishes.

Title: Undergrounded
Description: Peter builds a tunnel to the Drunken Clam after Lois grounds him for secretly getting a credit card and spending all of the family's money.

Title: Rich Old Stewie
Description: In the future, Stewie is a rich old man enjoying his retirement when Brian brings news about Peter dying.

Title: The Movement
Description: Peter becomes the face of racial justice when diarrhea makes him kneel during the national anthem as he starts coaching a minor league baseball team.

Title: Baby Stewie
Description: Stewie builds a machine to help him stay smart, but it turns him into an actual baby.

Title: Start Me Up
Description: Peter is told to work from home when his sweat becomes a liability; Stewie and Chris create a fake Kickstarter campaign with Brian to pay for the damages done to an electronics store.

Title: Coma Guy
Description: Peter's newfound love for rocking out to Van Halen results in him getting into a car accident and falling into a coma.

Title: Better Off Meg
Description: The Griffins experience life without Meg when she's erroneously reported to have died in a car crash, and she goes along with the story to start a new life elsewhere.

Title: Holly Bibble
Description: Following another blackout, the Griffins re-imagine three stories from the Bible about Adam and Eve, Noah, and the Last Supper while cooped up in a motel room during a storm.

Title: Movin' In (Principal Shepherd's Song)
Description: Principal Shepherd moves in with the Griffins when he gets fired for fat-shaming Chris at school; Brian sues Stewie for portraying him as an idiot in a series of children's books.

Title: Stewie's First Word
Description: Stewie finally says his first word - and it's a swear, leaving Lois shunned by the other moms, so she tries to figure out where Stewie could've heard it.

Title: The Talented Mr. Stewie
Description: Stewie "breaks up with" Rupert after learning that he used to belong to Chris and decides to take action.

Title: Boys & Squirrels
Description: When Peter hurts himself and a family of squirrels in a chainsaw accident, Chris and Stewie nurse one of the squirrels back to health; a chiropractor realigns Peter's spine and restores him to his true height.

Title: CutawayLand
Description: Peter and Lois get transported into a cutaway that they inadvertently set up at the same time.

Title: La Famiglia Guy
Description: Peter becomes a real gangster when Joe asks him to be the godfather of his daughter.

Title: Meg's Wedding
Description: Meg plans her wedding to an unexpected resident of Quahog; Peter loses his arms on one of his many adventures after finding a new vest.

Title: Wild Wild West
Description: Peter seeks out the cousin of the late Adam West when he disapproves of Lois' first choice to be the next mayor of Quahog.

Title: Pawtucket Pat
Description: Brian gets a job as a journalist and discovers that Pawtucket Pat, the hero of Quahog and founder of the brewery, was a racist, so the town becomes divided over whether to take down his commemorative statue.

Title: The First No L
Description: The Griffins must save Christmas without Lois when she walks out on them for failing to help her with the shopping.

Title: Fecal Matters
Description: Peter volunteers at the hospital after making it through a bad flu season and finds himself at a crossroads when his mortal enemy, The Giant Chicken, is admitted to ER. After learning he's part cat, Brian has an identity crisis.

Title: Boy's Best Friend
Description: Brian bonds with his new girlfriend's son; Peter, Quagmire, and Cleveland take a joyride in Joe's new classic Corvette.

Title: And Then There's Fraud
Description: Peter and Chris start a memorabilia business after going to a baseball game; Stewie gets plastic surgery to combat aging, but takes it too far.

Title: PeTerminator
Description: Stewie builds a Terminator resembling Peter to destroy Lois for trying to make him eat broccoli, but his life is in danger when things don't go as planned.

Title: The Marrying Kind
Description: Stewie experiences domestic life when he gets a mail-order bride from Ukraine; Peter and Chris become addicted to free hotel breakfast buffets.

Title: Customer of the Week
Description: After feeling unappreciated by the family, Lois taps into her villainous side and attempts to win "Best Customer" at her favorite coffee shop.

Title: Who's Brian Now?
Description: A microchip in Brian reveals that he once lived with another family, making it difficult for him to enjoy his life with the Griffins.

Title: Young Parent Trap
Description: A couple at Stewie's school mistake Peter and Lois for "younger parents" and invite them to live in a millennial apartment complex, leaving Meg and Chris home alone.

Title: Meg Goes to College
Description: Meg endures a college admissions scandal caused by Peter and Lois; Brian goes on a fitness journey.

Title: Family Cat
Description: The Griffins adopt a cat that Brian believes is evil.

Title: Tales of Former Sports Glory
Description: Cleveland, Quagmire, and Peter share stories of athletic accomplishments from their youth.

Title: LASIK Instinct
Description: Lois decides to get LASIK surgery, but exploits her failing vision for personal gain; Peter, Chris, Stewie, and Brian must partake in activities with Doug that his father neglects.

Title: Rock Hard
Description: While at an old record store, Peter and the guys tell stories of three rock legends: Jim Morrison, Muddy Waters, and Elton John.

Title: Must Love Dogs
Description: Quagmire pretends Brian is his dog when he meets an avid dog lover; Chris helps Stewie retrieve his stolen Halloween candy.

Title: 80's Guy
Description: Peter's nostalgia for the '80s compels him to recreate iconic movie scenes from that decade; Stewie competes with Doug to retrieve a frisbee from the top of the jungle gym.

Title: Brief Encounter
Description: Peter and Quagmire mimic each other's behavior when they accidentally switch underwear; Stewie and Doug agree to commit each other's murders.

Title: Cootie & The Blowhard
Description: Stewie fears he has a terminal case of "cooties"; Peter enjoys Bonnie's cooking.

Title: Peterschmidt Manor
Description: Peter turns the Pewterschmidt mansion into a hotel while Lois and Carter attend the funeral of Lois' childhood nanny.

Title: The Birthday Bootlegger
Description: Peter's new boss bans his favorite part about work: office birthdays; Stewie gets detention and turns rough.

Title: The Fatman Always Rings Twice
Description: Peter does a noir-style investigation of Meg's disappearance.

Title: Christmas Crime
Description: Brian is accused of ruining Mayor West's nativity scene.

Title: Mister Act
Description: Peter has an accident that leaves him with a high-pitched voice, so Jesus helps him fend off the other choir boys; Stewie becomes attracted to Lois' masculine physique.

Title: The Lois Quagmire
Description: Lois takes Quagmire to her high school reunion instead of Peter; the rest of the family tries to cover up a pizza delivery man's death.

Title: Lawyer Guy
Description: Peter hires the town's new lawyer, Brick Baker, to represent him in litigation against his new neighbor, who turns out to be Brick. Brian and Stewie become lobstermen and save Rupert from the perils of the deep.

Title: HBO-No
Description: The Griffins present their versions of three HBO shows: "Game of Thrones", "Succession" and "Big Little Lies".

Title: Hard Boiled Meg
Description: Meg becomes a getaway driver; Quagmire, unable to cure his hiccups, asks Peter to kill him.

Title: Prescription Heroine
Description: Lois becomes addicted to painkillers prescribed for Brian after he gets hurt. Peter's ping pong table becomes the hot spot in the neighborhood.

Title: All About Alana
Description: Lois' piano student, Alana, comes to work for the Griffins and turns out to have sinister intentions.

Title: Girlfriend, Eh?
Description: Peter and Chris go to Canada to prove that Chris' girlfriend exists; Lois and Meg fight each other for the attention of a handsome handyman.

Title: First Blood
Description: Peter and the guys test their physical prowess at Mayor West's dude ranch; Stewie believes he's gotten his first period.

Title: Jersey Bore
Description: Peter goes to a business conference in Atlantic City with Preston; Stewie helps Chris prepare for his role in Adam West High's presentation of "Romeo and Juliet".
